meanings.definition: To build or construct something vertically.
meanings.sent1: The worker erects a tall tower in the city.
meanings.sent2: The children erect a sandcastle at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel erects a tiny acorn house in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The artist erects a masterpiece from clay and paint.
meanings.sent5: The gardener erects a fence to protect the flowers.

meanings.definition: To cause something to stand up or become upright.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind erects the flag on the pole.
meanings.sent2: The teacher erects the whiteboard for the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The magician erects a card tower with a flick of the wrist.
meanings.sent4: The coach erects the team's morale with an inspiring speech.
meanings.sent5: The sun erects the shadows of the trees in the morning light.
